snippet: The anticipated closeness of the presidential race did not deter Republican and Democratic political die-hards from heading into ballrooms and bars around the state to watch election returns.
abstract: Republican and Democratic political die-hards in deeply contested Florida repair to bars, ballrooms and other venues to watch election returns; enthusiasm runs high among Democrats as string of electoral victories are broadcast, though the fate of Florida's own electoral votes remains unclear after Pres Obama's victory.

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami, and Campbell Robertson from Tampa, Fla.

lead_paragraph: The anticipated closeness of the presidential race did not deter Republican and Democratic political die-hards from heading into ballrooms and bars around the state to watch election returns.

headline.main: Partisans in Florida Retreat to Their Corners to Wait Out a Cliffhanger
headline.print_headline: Partisans in Florida Retreat to Their Corners To Wait Out a Cliffhanger
